conclusion: To find the magnitude of the induced electromotive force (EMF) in the coil, we can use Faraday's Law of Electromagnetic Induction.
The induced EMF in a rotating coil in a uniform magnetic field is given by: \( \mathcal{E} = n B A \omega \sin(\omega t) \)
Calculate the area \( A \) of the coil: \( A = l_{AB} \times l_{BC} = 0.2 \, \text{m} \times 0.5 \, \text{m} = 0.1 \, \text{m}^2 \)

premise: Substitute the given values into the formula for the induced EMF: \( \mathcal{E} = n B A \omega \sin(\omega t) \)
conclusion: Since timing starts when the coil plane passes through the neutral plane, at \( t = 0 \), \( \sin(\omega t) = \sin(0) = 0 \).

premise: We are interested in the maximum induced EMF, which occurs when \( \sin(\omega t) = 1 \).
conclusion: The maximum induced EMF is: \( \mathcal{E}_{\text{max}} = n B A \omega \)
